item.title: Elizabeth Warren on Youth Jobs
item.description:
Elizabeth Warren, democratic candidate for US Senate in Massachusetts and a professor at Harvard University, recently visited the Maverick Landing Youth Group here in East Boston. They invited her to talk specifically about youth jobs- a big concern for these young people since their positions rely on state funding.

ZUMIX Radio's reporter, Cassanova Robinson, recorded their conversation. Listen to a segment of what they talked about here:


Cassanova also had the chance to ask Elizabeth Warren his own question after the event:
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (Zumix Radio)

item.title: MBTA Fare Hike interview
item.description:
This week on The House of Beats and Environmental Justice News, host Oscar Garcia interviewed Riggy from the Chelsea Creek Action Group about MBTA fare hikes and the recent vigil protesting these hikes at the State House.

Listen to their fabulous conversation here:



A few days prior to their conversation, "The Fast Five" busted into an MBTA board meeting!

Tune into The House of Beats and Environmental Justice News every Monday at 5pm on ZUMIX Radio!

item.title: Enviornmental Justice News from the House of Beats
item.description:
Ever listened to The House of Beats and Environmen
tal Justice (EJ) News on ZUMIX Radio? Mondays at 5pm, Oscar brings techno, hard-style and local EJ news to our "airwaves." This week's EJ segment focuses on the upcoming Bailaton in East Boston this Saturday, March 17th. It's a dance-a-thon fundraiser for NOAH's community building and environment work and the Chelsea Creek Action Group (CCAG).

Oscar explains it all here:

item.description:
Moya Brennan and Cormac De Barra in the ZUMIX Radio studio

This past weekend, ZUMIX Radio hosted a special live broadcast of the Moya Brennan and Cormac De Barra performance at the ZUMIX Firehouse.

Before the show, Kassandra got to interview Moya and Cormac in the ZUMIX Radio studio! They are on tour for their new album Voices and Harps. Here's a segment of that interview:

Kassandra Otero hosting!

item.title: Bullied: Teen Radio Stories
item.description:
We are really excited that a story produced by a ZUMIX Radio young person was selected and included in a new radio special! Cassanova Robinson produced "Why I got called Osama in High School" for Bullied: Teen Stories from Generation PRX - a collection of youth produced radio stories about bullying from a nationwide network of youth producers. 
Unlike other work that talks about young people, this hour long special gives teenagers the opportunity to offer their personal perspectives and angles to the national conversation around bullying.


You can listen here to the hour long special, Bullied: Teen Stories from Generation PRX
There is a resource page for the program here through Generation PRX- a hub for youth produced radio work.

And, you can check out the Bullied discussion on Facebook. Share your own thoughts!
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (Zumix Radio)

item.title: ICA Fast Forward Teens live on ZUMIX Radio
item.description:
The ZUMIX Radio studio's been full with visits the past few weeks! Teens from the Teen New Media Program at Boston’s ICA visited on February 2nd and 3rd to share audio work produced in the Fast Forward class. We aired two special broadcasts, hosted by ZUMIX's Leona Smith and Johnn Vasquez (DJ Johnny V).
Fourteen students total from the Fast Forward program shared audio pieces and their ideas for short films they have just started producing.







Listen here for both broadcasts:

ICA Fast Forward teens on ZUMIX Radio, February 2, 2012 hosted by Leona Smith


ICA Fast Forward teens on ZUMIX Radio, February 3, 2012 hosted by Johnn Vasquez

item.title: Terrascope Youth Radio visits ZUMIX Radio
item.description:
On February 6th, two members of Terrascope Youth Radio (TYR) in Cambridge visited the ZUMIX Radio studios. Kassandra Otero, host of The Junk Box (Wednesdays 7-8pm) interviewed Andy Cox and Aria Morgan about TYR and shared two of their most recent features, "Our Hollow Earth" and "Can I do Anything More?"

Take a listen to their complete interview here

item.title: Commentaries by Meridian Academy
item.description:
Meridian Academy class visits ZUMIX
ZUMIX Radio recently worked with students at Meridian Academy to produce short commentaries based on research papers they wrote for class.  We focused on personal stories to create these commentaries and to transform their research into a message. Here is the collection of commentaries they produced:






 Watch out for the special broadcast of this collection of commentaries on ZUMIX Radio soon!

Leona working at BK

item.title: Transmit profiles
item.description:
An assignment we were given in Transmit class, was to create a profile of someone who had a story to tell. We completed profiles on the topics of older music and what it means to the listener, teen pregnancy and the obstacles, and also the stress and ambitions of life in the 1930's-1940's compared to what it is now. We all interviewed a very important person in our lives, and were able to complete our own unique interesting pieces. And here they are..



Cassanova's profile of his dad
Cassanova Robinson


The opinion of a man trying to show how music from the 60's and 70's is still good. My dad, Carl Robinson, of East Boston explains how music from his era is better than the music kids or some adults listen to now a days. Even though he likes his music better he still thinks that both his music and our music are okay.












Leona's profile of her 'Noni'
Leona Smith
" Each generation goes further than the generation preceding it because it stands on the shoulders of that generation. " - Ronald Reagan


In this profile, I interviewed my grandmother, Antonette Smith, or as I call her, Noni, about her life when she was a teenager. She was born into a family of 11 children, in the 1930's. A nickel was a lot of money, and an idea of a good time was sitting around the kitchen table with your family. Not that many people were going to college, because school was not as important as it is now. According to her, everything has changed. There was barely any stress and all she could ask for was a family of her o
wn. 




 Laura's profile of her Mom
Laura Loiza




In my conversation with my mother, she tells me about her "little monster" coming into the world (by the way, "little monster" is me!) We also discuss her thoughts and feelings about how motherhood changed her.
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (Zumix Radio)

item.description:
News Headlines by ZUMIX Radio 

Students in the Transmit (radio journalism class here at ZUMIX) learned this week how to write news headlines! AND, students in the Radio Active (Dj training class) learned how to read headlines. Here's the headlines and the readings:

Red Sox GM Leaves
Written by: Cassanova Robinson 10/13/11

After 9 years of Leading the Boston Red Sox to the finals and winning 2 World Series, General Manager, Theo Epstein, leaves today to join the Chicago Cubs. He turned a group of men that once was okay into a great team. After being transferred to the Cubs he says his last good-bye to the team he had made.

[[Theo Epstein]]: “Till next time”

Read by Melissa:
Read by D:


Less money, Less babies.
Written by: Leona Smith 10/13/11

Since the recession, 48 out of 50 of the states have seen a drop in birth rates. The data collected in 2010 showed a drop from 69.6 thousand births in 2007, to 64.7 thousand in 2010. Minorities make up a large percentage of those affected. From 2008 to 2009, Hispanics have seen a 5.9 percent decrease, while birth rates among black women have seen a 2.4 percent drop.

Read by: Joshua
Read by: Amanda
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (Zumix Radio)

item.title: TRANSMIT commentaries preview
item.description:
Our newly named radio production class, TRANSMIT, is in full swing!
Folks are learning how to use recording equipment, edit their first interviews and write commentary. Stay tuned for audio introductions of the new radio journalists and their commentaries with the following themes:
Family structure, mine vs theirs
Where are you from? Discrimination based on skin color
We don't say anything that matters, breaking down a philosophy quote
When you exercise, how do you feel?
Little kids can be heroes too

Stay tuned!
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (Zumix Radio)

item.title: ZUMIX Radio DJs report back from New York City
item.description:
In the beginning of March, two of the fabulous ZUMIX Radio DJs- Chris Frangolini and Kassandra Otero- traveled to New York City for the 71st Annual IBS International Radio, TV, Webcasting and Podcasting Conference. Planted right across the street from Madison Square Garden and down the street from Time Square, we spent the weekend learning, networking and embedding ourselves in the bustle of New York City. Here are report-backs from the journey:


Chris's report-back:

My trip to the big apple for the 71st Annual IBS International Radio, TV, Webcasting and Podcasting Conference described in one word would be amazing. Between the interesting workshops and the eye-dropping tall buildings the experience was memorable.

I am Chris Frangolini host of On The Fly Sports Radio Show, the only teen sports talk show in Boston. My show is live on ZUMIX Radio every Tuesday at 6-p.m.. Personally, I took a lot back from the conference and got tons of tips and tricks of the game of being an up and coming sportscaster. I even got several contacts, which I have kept in touch with either through email, text, or facebook. That was one of the most important things I have learned from the conference that social networking is extremely important.

My favorite workshop had to be Conducting Great Interviews. I liked that workshop because interviewing is an essential skill to have as a sportscaster. I learned that when conducting an interview to make sure that you have really done your homework and have a set guideline of questions to ask. I also met a fellow sportscaster Ray, who broadcasts for audio8ball.com, and from Mt. San Antonio College's Radio Broadcasting Program, and we hit it off talking for at least four or five hours. We talked about the most random things from family, to school, to being on the radio. Ray and I have stayed in touch and I will be having him as a guest on my radio show, On The Fly, soon.



Elena, Kassandra, and I even got to go to the Empire State Building and went to the 86th floor! All the way up there we got to see the broadcast facilities of a few New York radio stations. I fell in love with Journalism and Radio Broadcasting and I hope to pursue that career. Overall, this was a once in a lifetime thing. I love ZUMIX for giving me the opportunity to go. I really feel apart of the ZUMIX family.

Chris is the host of On the Fly Teen Sports Radio Show which airs Tuesday nights from 6-8pm and Week in Review, a weekly teen news spot that airs Friday, Saturday and Sunday at 5pm on ZUMIX Radio.



Kassandra's report-back:


My experience in New York for the IBS Conference was amazing. Being able to meet people who enjoy producing radio and having people give you information and advice on how to make it in the radio world was an incredible experience. The best piece of advice that I received from Beth Becall, a present of one of the workshops and an experience radio DJ, was to learn everything you possibly can before you do anything to pursue your dream in radio broadcasting.


Being at the conference made my love for radio grow deeper. One of the workshops I attended was Hip-Hop Programming On Air. The majority of people in the workshop were college students with an exception of 3 high schoolers, including myself. Being one of the youngest in the workshop changed my perspective on playing old school Hip-Hop on my show, The Junk Box. It made me appreciate old school Hip-Hop and the meaning of real Hip-Hop even more.


Going to New York and meeting all these people, who are experiences in radio broadcasting was an experience of my lifetime. I met so many new people from L.A. that I now can network with and get

 more advice from them. In particular, we got to meet other high school students from LA who broadcast on their own radio station. They are from CHAMPS Charter High School and their station is called Arts and Entertainment Radio (you can listen online here). After meeting at the conference, we went out with them for pizza and conversation! They are awesome. We connected with one ambition: radio, even though we are from two completely different worlds.






Kassandra (DJ Kassie Knock-Out) is the host of the Junk Box which airs Wednesday nights from 7-8pm on ZUMIX Radio.








You can see additional photos of our trip from the ZUMIX Radio Facebook page
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (Zumix Radio)

Week in Review is a new weekly segment starting today! Airing every Friday, Saturday and Sunday at 5pm, Week in Review is a recap and commentary of hot topics of the week from a youth perspective.

item.title: And we present: Zumix Radio Journalist audio projects!
item.description:
It was a fabulous semester here in radio journalism.

Our theme was East Boston: the old, the new and you. We wanted folks in the class to think deeply about the place of East Boston. That could mean exploring a particular location, person, social or political issue. And the theme offered a framework for students to pursue stories from a variety of perspectives, time-frames and narratives.

The process of the class took us everywhere from analyzing media images around us, thinking about how to describe the world using all of our senses, and listening to a whole bunch of youth-produced audio. And, we got to talk about all sorts of things in East Boston: things we like and some things we don't like as much.
Take a listen to these fantastic pieces!

Haley Collibee researched, a lot. She was curious about the rate of teen pregnancy in East Boston compared to the rest of the city, and the country. While she's still trying to find the numbers, she went out on the street to gather a variety of human perspectives on Teenage Pregnancy in East Boston.

Esmeralda Mendez lives in East Boston but does not attend the one high school in Eastie. She wondered why some parents send their kids to other schools. She explores this question in her piece Eastie vs O'Bryant. (note: this piece is in two parts. She introduces an interview that she performed live and that recording is omitted)
Eastie vs O'Bryant part 2

Lexii Viola started out wondering about racism in East Boston. But as she started asking questions, her story transformed. Listen to Changes in East Boston to hear this journey.

Marvin Gonzales grew up in East Boston. One day in class he told us a story about the dirt park he used to play in as a kid and how one day he noticed the area transforming. Marvin set-out to explore the changes in the area around Logan International Airport since he was a kid. This Airport Audio Tour piece is a collage of his audio-walking-tour around that location.
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (Zumix Radio)

Happy holidays ya'll!

item.description:
Journalism students are getting it done!
A few weeks ago, they interviewed each other about the short radio documentaries they are producing about a whole host of things East Boston. These radio documentaries will be done in a few weeks- stay tuned for that.
Click to listen to their previews:

Marvin is researching the changes in the area around the airport since we was a kid.

Lala is comparing two high schools, O'Bryant and East Boston High.

Lexii is exploring the complicated topic of racism within her very own community.

And Haley is working on a story about teen pregnancy in East Boston....audio to come!
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (Zumix Radio)

item.title: A Week in Review, a new weekly feature
item.description:
ZUMIX Radio presents: A Week in Review.
It's a new weekly feature that will offer reviews of news, sports, entertainment and anything else that sparks our interest from a youth perspective. And, it's hosted by Chis Frangolini, ZUMIX Radio's very own DJ of the weekly show, On the Fly: sports radio show.
This week, students in the Radio Journalism class had their first go at news announcing.
Listen to A Week in Review live on ZUMIX Radio on Fridays at 5pm or listen here:
A Week in Review, November 5, 2010
item.author: noreply@blogger.com (Zumix Radio)
